intro: Doritis natmataungensis, commonly known as the Burmese starwort, is a flowering plant native to Myanmar. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Doritis natmataungensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
